logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: The CUT's public interface does not have to be affected if visibility is increased private->internal and protected->protected internal.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Figured out how to cite several references at once, so collapsed all of the multi-references. 2 - Fixed a use of underline. 3 - Found another source for "defects are more expensive to fix the more you wait". 4 - Added some notes. 5 - Started adding/fixing content for section 4.1.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added a feature to iTeX to convert a double quote preceded by a space to the LaTeX way of opening quotes, that is to say two backticks.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Switched to XeTeX to be able to disable ligatures without disabling other text enhancements.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Fixed typo in reference.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added an awesome quote by Binder to the state problem section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Slight improvements to Step 1. 2 - A lot of the motivations in Step 4 were moved to Design Decisions and some enhancements were performed at the same time. 3 - Added content for the Decisions made section and cleaned up some notes. 4 - Moved some notes to the Results chapter. 5 - Deleted the Reproducibility section since that should be covered in Experiment design.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Noticed the authors' names were missing some "decorations" on some of the letters.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added note about possible talking point.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing the "Stateless version" of MortonLayout where the DecodeAxis() method was extracted to show that sometimes, computations should stay together for readability and/or performance. Also noted same in subsection 3.3.2

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Imported the tests for MortonLayout from the PivotStack project and adjusted the layout slightly.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing the SubversionClient class, inspired from functionality in BART.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Made some changes based on review feedback, mostly wording but added a new example and modified an existing one to allow for a better comparison.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added a citation for explicit interface implementations and fixed some related wording.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Added a note to the Design section to emphasize the importance of pure code refactoring. 2 - Provided content for the Applicability section. 3 - Removed notes that have since been handled/discussed or are no longer relevant.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing the proposed Stateless and Immutable attributes along with samples of their use, plus one unit test.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: - Enhanced one of the interesting candidate block categories and two of the uninteresting ones. - Increasing the amount of sample code shown for testing parsing and formatting. - Provided content for Section 3.3 (Suitability) with a TODO for a potential subsection 3.3.5

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing MutableVector and EuclideanVectorSpace to demonstrate a method that could still benefit from SME even though it does not manipulate HMS.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Re-ordered the tests so it matches the order of the parsing and formatting code in the CUT.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: - Added a TODO about static vs. instance methods in candidate block identification. - Decided to pluralize return values everywhere for simplicity since I already do it for input parameters anyway. - Provided content for steps 4, 5 and 6. - Added yet more notes and potential talking points.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Extracted the stateless CrossProduct() method and added a unit test for it.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: For the Stateless version, extracted the DotProduct() method and added a unit test for it.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a Plane class (and its dependent Vector class) that illustrates some inline math and a unit test.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added another test for the CodeFormatMatchEvaluator; one that is more direct but requires more "arrange".

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a variation of SME: Regex instance extraction. This means the tests don't have to create an instance of the Regex class that could be configured differently from the one used during execution (if RegexOptions had been used). It could also increase performance, assuming the Regex class does not attempt to cache compiled patterns when calling the static methods.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a variation of SME: constant extraction. This allows the parsing to be tested independently of the replacement, as shown by the new unit test.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a simplified and reflowed version of the CodeBlockModifier from the Textile project, with SME on the CodeFormatMatchEvaluator() method and two unit tests.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a simplified and reflowed version of the CodeBlockModifier from the Textile project, with a unit test.

logentry.author: nado18@gmail.com
logentry.msg:
Generating eBook for thesis in ePub format
1- Converting thesis to ePub 1.1- Adding xsl to output thesis in html 1.2- Adding css stylesheet to go along html 1.3- Adding ePub stub into which generated html and css are dropped 2- Adding Makefile to automate step 1 3- Adding thesis.html and thesis.epub to svn:ignore property

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: - Further improved Overview, Step 1 and Step 2 - Provided some initial content for Step 3 - Added yet more notes/discussion about scope and philosophy

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Come to think of it, the method was calculating the radians between two coordinates and thus moved the radius multiplication into it and added a unit test.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing the [partially-] stateless variant on the Travelling Salesperson Problem that computes the great-circle distance between any two cities, assuming the salesperson will be flying. The ToRadians() method was extracted to enable its testing. Includes two unit tests.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Introducing a variant on the Travelling Salesperson Problem that computes the great-circle distance between any two cities, assuming the salesperson will be flying. Includes a unit test.

logentry.msg: Introducing an adapted, standalone version of FootNoteFormatterState, reflowed for inclusion in the text.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Reflowed the sample code to fit within the 52-characters per line limit. Added content to the "identification" phase and provided an example of the first category.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added the stateless version of the example of some processing that contains a candidate block inside a loop, with said candidate block extracted into its own method and the new unit test it allows.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Now compiling and running unit tests in the samples, which incidentally fixes the missing assembly problem.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Shuffled the contents of the Approach chapter to have the Design section be all about how SME works. 2 - Shifted the first line of the items in the Overview section to have a nicer collapsed view. 3 - Introducing a pseudo-code version of the general SME procedure. 4 - Added a draft of part of the first step of SME.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added the realCode listings style, which required redefining the lstinputlisting command to avoid a parsing error when a listing is used inside a tabular. Also added a few notes about decisions made.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added some notes in the Approach chapter.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added to the first subsection of the Design section.

logentry.msg: Replaced instances of "i.e." with other forms, sometimes removing it completely. Also fixed a typo.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Started writing content for the Design section of the Approach chapter, mostly in the form of visible TODOs.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Fixed typos and added some code for non-breaking spaces before references.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Initial preliminary content for the Scope section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Blocks must have their options after their param and said option should not occur in the closing of the environment.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: It seems the Context section is unnecessary, since the Related work section would cover the same content.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Use non-blocking invocations of PDFXCView. 2 - Bind F5 to the same as F7. 3 - Contributed content for the Related work section, with lots of references.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Finished adding references to existing text.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Forcing word-wrap initially on. 2 - Added yet more references, fixed a few of them. 3 - Added lots of citations.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added some missing references and corrected/enhanced a few existing ones. Added some code to make sure spaces before citations are non-breaking. Now using the url and hyperref packages to make URLs and other links in the document (table of contents, references, etc.) clickable. This required switching to pdflatex, but also allowed some PDF properties to be set. Started adding citations and fixing up as well as expanding some ideas that turned out to not have been made by the authors. The first pair of listings had to be moved into the Motivation section to avoid an awkward blank section because the code listings are not floating. Introducing a batch file that closes and re-opens the PDF between builds.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added remaining papers and made a minor fix to the text.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Made a few changes recommended by Dwight and added most of my references to the Bib database.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Provided content for the Intents of CGT section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Improved the Automatic Testing section with a note about sampling. 2 - Provided some content for the Concolic Testing section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - Trimmed spaces at the end of lines. 2 - Fixed a quote block. 3 - Improved part of the "Automated testing" section. 4 - Enhanced the "Motivation for CGT" section. 5 - Relocated the "Intents of CGT" section to after the "Approaches to CGT" section. 6 - Provided content for the RT and SBST subsections.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: 1 - It turns out I meant "statement coverage". 2 - Fixed up the OOP section. 3 - Added content to the Automated testing section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added a few minor features to iTeX, renaming the <e> element to <m> since its primary purpose is math. Fixed the existing uses of <e> to either <em> or <tt>. Provided content for the Intro and OOP sections of the Background chapter.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Removed some obsolete comments (some of them were transferred), moved most of the content that was in Objectives to a new "Evaluation/experiment design" section, although said content is alluded to. Added a note regarding a possible scope narrowing.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Reworked the Goal section to be more general (improve testability) and moved the specifics (stateless method extraction) to the Objectives section, rewording in the process.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Mostly small English-related improvements, but also expanded upon the combination of hidden + mutable instance state is the real problem.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Made changes as suggested by Dwight.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Expanded in the Problem section, providing an example in the form of two source code listings. Added a bit of content to the Motivation section, providing an example in the form of two source code listings. Reformatted the stateless SmokeDetector to fit in its half-page column.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added the Stateless project, adapting the SmokeDetector and SmokeDetectorTest samples to trivially extract a stateless method, then write a test for a subset thereof.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added an "Acronyms" appendix with most of the acronyms used so far.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Now using the "listings" package (with appropriate configuration and references) and took the opportunity to rename a grouping of related mark-up a "region".

logentry.msg: Added a semi-related paper to the bibliography database.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Replaced most of the batch file with an MSBuild script that will fail faster and allow more complicated assembly.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: A few small fixes, but mostly notes and TODOs.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Mostly added content to the Goals section but also a bit to the Objectives section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: A few corrections and enhancements to the Problem section. Expanded the Motivation section. Started writing some of the Goals section.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Patched iTeX to allow for "inline comments". Replaced dashes with equal signs in comments, because some XSL parsers freak out if they see "--" inside a comment but not at the end of it. Added content mostly in the Introduction and Background chapters.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Added lots of notes on possible talking points.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Upgraded to the latest version of iTeX, which now supports multi-line comments.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Simplified the chapters to more closely match the suggested outline, added comments and turned existing notes into comments.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Specifying a tab size of 2 spaces.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais@gmail.com
logentry.msg: Adjusted build to generate "letter"-sized pages instead of the default A4.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais@gmail.com
logentry.msg: Added the Mcminn03thestate BibTeX entry and a sample citation for testing.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Disabled ligatures to make the PDF more copy-pasteable and filled in some basic template values.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Initial commit of the thesis-related files: 1 - dalthesis.cls: TeX class file from http://people.scs.carleton.ca/~jeanpier//template/ 2 - thesis.itex: The iTeX version of PhD Template.tex from http://people.scs.carleton.ca/~jeanpier//template/ 3 - iTeX.xsl: The iTeX stylesheet from http://github.com/olivierdagenais/iTeX as of commit 7453995a88b6a3ac91dee7197dd778321b2d18b1 4 - thesis.bib: A blank BibTeX database created with JabRef 5 - build.bat: A batch file to compile and assemble all the files into a PDF file, assuming there's a LaTeX distribution (such as TexLive) and xsl.exe in the path 6 - SciTE.properties: Convenience keyboard mappings for the SciTE text editor to launch build.bat or the compiled PDF file.

logentry.author: olivier.dagenais
logentry.msg: Adding top-level thesis folder
